author: nero_eth
content: yeah devnet-2, although the benchmarking for repricing will need to be done on a shadowfork of mainnet + bloatnet state. So, we don't necessarily need the batch IO optimization for devnet-2 (since there won't be realistic state), but still need them for the repricing benchmarks

author: nero_eth
content:
As soon as we have at least 2 clients with the batch IO implemented, I'd suggest spinning up a shadowfork soon, wdyt, <@412614104222531604> , <@577788234810130432> ?
Besu is ready, geth is close, I think nethermind too ( <@348512261955911691> ). Would be curious what ppl think wrt timelines here?

author: barnabasbusa
content: order should be, hive tests passed, devnet 2 launched, happy case and edge cases covered, sf

author: barnabasbusa
content: we are still struggling to pass all hive tests for most clients

author: nero_eth
content: Right, I haven't thought that we have the 4 new EIPs then also on the shadowfork and not just the BAL implementation. Agree, then let's get the tests pass first before thinking of shadowforking mainnet.

author: qu0b
content: lets not change the goal posts for the optimizations, lets use devnet-2 as the test bed for the optimizations and the shadow fork will then be used to actually measure their impact.

author: nero_eth
content: Yeah agree, and we can have some worst-case transactions (esp. for execution related things) already be tested and benchmarked directly on devnet 2, having the exec parallelization in place.

author: nero_eth
content: What was the latest re the gas limit for devnet-2? Is 150m still the latest?

author: matkt0
content: I just need to merge the batch io branch into devnet2 branch. I'll do it today.

author: qu0b
content: We're nearly good to go for devnet-2, we have 3 clients ready now besu, nimbus and nethermind

author: holgerd77
content:
Hey hey,
EthereumJS BAL implementation is more or less ready ðŸ¤© , a few more tests to fix but otherwise complete (if someone is interested, see https://github.com/ethereumjs/ethereumjs-monorepo/pull/4233.

After fighting through all of the implementation details during the last days I asked Cursor (on Sonnet 4.5) to use the experiences made and see where the spec can be improved to ease implementation complexity and/or clarify.

Don't want to "spam" here with AI bloat, but I skimmed through the answers and while some might be a bit too implementation-focused, others might be worth to consider, so decided it's worth to share:
